str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Chaldee origin; fig-house; Beth-phage, a place in Palestine.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
An olive tree; the Mount of Olives. Feminine of a presumed derivative from an obsolete primary; an olive.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
